title: Common Blouse Fitting Problems and How to Fix Them
meta_description: Learn to identify and fix common saree blouse fitting issues like tight armholes, pulling at bust, gaping neckline, and shoulder fitting problems.
excerpt: Even experienced tailors encounter fitting issues. Learn to diagnose and fix the most common blouse fitting problems to achieve that perfect fit your customers deserve.
author: CuttingMaster Team
content:
## Introduction

A well-fitted blouse should feel comfortable and look elegant. However, achieving this perfect fit can be challenging. In this guide, we will explore the most common fitting problems and their solutions.

## Problem 1: Tight Armholes

**Symptoms:**
- Difficulty raising arms
- Fabric pulling at the underarm
- Discomfort when moving

**Causes:**
- Armhole cut too small
- Incorrect armhole depth measurement
- Not enough ease added

**Solutions:**
- Increase armhole depth by 0.5 to 1 inch
- Lower the underarm point
- For existing blouses, carefully unpick and add a gusset

## Problem 2: Pulling at the Bust

**Symptoms:**
- Horizontal wrinkles across the bust
- Buttons straining
- Fabric pulling open

**Causes:**
- Bust measurement too small
- Not enough ease for bust fullness
- Dart placement incorrect

**Solutions:**
- Add 2-3 inches ease to bust measurement
- Reposition bust darts
- Consider princess seams for larger busts

## Problem 3: Gaping Neckline

**Symptoms:**
- Neckline stands away from body
- Visible gap when bending
- Uncomfortable appearance

**Causes:**
- Neck opening too wide
- Shoulder slope incorrect
- Back neck too deep

**Solutions:**
- Reduce neckline width
- Adjust shoulder seam angle
- Add darts at the back neck

## Problem 4: Shoulder Seam Falling Off

**Symptoms:**
- Seam sits on arm instead of shoulder
- Sleeve hangs awkwardly
- Overall poor fit appearance

**Causes:**
- Shoulder measurement too wide
- Incorrect shoulder point placement

**Solutions:**
- Reduce shoulder width
- Reposition seam to correct point
- Adjust sleeve cap accordingly

## Problem 5: Back Pulling Up

**Symptoms:**
- Blouse rides up at the back
- Hemline uneven
- Uncomfortable wearing

**Causes:**
- Back length too short
- Posture not accounted for
- Sway back not adjusted

**Solutions:**
- Increase back length
- Add a sway back adjustment
- Ensure measurements taken with natural posture

## Problem 6: Wrinkles Under Bust

**Symptoms:**
- Horizontal folds below bust
- Excess fabric gathering
- Unflattering appearance

**Causes:**
- Waist too loose
- Front length too long
- Dart ends at wrong point

**Solutions:**
- Take in at waist seams
- Shorten front length
- Adjust dart length and placement

## Prevention Tips

- Always take measurements over proper undergarments
- Double-check all measurements before cutting
- Make a muslin test garment for new customers
- Document adjustments for repeat customers
- Consider body shape variations

## When to Start Over

Sometimes alterations cannot fix major fitting issues. Consider remaking when:

- Multiple problems exist simultaneously
- Alterations would distort the design
- Fabric has been damaged by repeated alterations
- Customer expectations cannot be met with fixes

## Conclusion

Fitting problems are part of every tailor's journey. The key is to diagnose correctly and apply the right solution. With experience, you will develop an eye for spotting potential issues before they occur.
